explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At) are not included.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: It is an organic compound not containing oxygen, fluorine or chlorine.

organic_peroxides.rationale: The organic compound not including peroxy group in molecule.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was classified into "Not classified" from LD50 value of 4,700 to 5,100 mg/kg (JECFA (2001)) of the oral administration test (GLP) employing a rat.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: From a description of LD50 value of >2,000 mg/kg (JECFA (2001)) in the dermal administration test employing rabbits, it was classified into "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Since it was a solid by the definition of GHS and inhalation in gas was not assumed, it was classified into "Not applicable".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Saturated vapor pressure level at 25degCis 8.23*10^-5 mg/m3. Since LC50 value with >0.4 mg/L of the 4-hour inhalation exposure test employing rats (JECFA (2001)) is larger than saturated vapor pressure level, classification cannot be specified when applying the dust and mist standard, and classification is not possible.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Classification is not possible since there is no data.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification is not possible because of insufficient data.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Although there is a description of "positive" in the mutagenicity test employing in vitro bacteria (NTP DB (Access on October 2008)), classification is not possible because there is no data of in vivo examination.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: HSDB (2003) has a description that "there is no evidence of carcinogenicityity in any of the short-term and long-term examinations in many of animals", however, classification is not possible since no evaluation by major international evaluation agencies has been made.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: A primary document (Food Chem Toxicol.22 (1984)) of the study with mice published in JECFA (2001) was acquired for the thorough review and found a description as follows, "Significant body weight reduction with fetuses, significant increase in external surface abnormalities such as cleft palates, significant decrease in the number of live fetuses and significant increase of skeletal abnormalities such as fusion of vertebral arch and vertebra were observed at the dose level where suppression of body weight, increase in weight of the liver, heart, lien and kidney can be observed." For the reasons stated above, it was classified as Category 1B.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: The oral administration test employing a mouse has a description that "the nephrotoxicity of dose-dependent is caused. The effect of this substance reaches to the maximum in 2 or 3 days then is recovered afterward" (JECFA (2001)). Since these influences were seen within the limits of the guidance value of Category 1, they were taken as Category 1 (kidney).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney, thyroid, hematopoietic system)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: There are descriptions of "Thyroid weight increase, hypertrophy of a thyroid follicle cell, hyperplasia of red corpuscle of bone marrow, the increase in the number of blood platelets" occur in 13-weeks oral administration test employing rats. (JECFA (2001)) and of "splenic extramedullary hematopoiesis increase, vacuolization of the dose-dependent nephric tubule in the female, and the increased hemosiderin deposition of a lienal" are produced " in 52-weeks oral administration test employing dogs (JECFA (2001)). Since these influences were seen within the range of the guidance value of Category 2, it was classified into Category 2 (kidney, thyroid gland, blood system).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.31mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (AQUIRE (2008)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there were no rapid degradability (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 1.
